assessment.name: Cowch IMAGINE Framework Assessment
assessment.description: Chat-based wellness assessment using Mandy's IMAGINE framework
assessment.author: Mandy Lehto

frameworkDimensions.name: Action
frameworkDimensions.description: How you translate ideas into behavior

frameworkDimensions.name: Growth
frameworkDimensions.description: Your capacity for learning and change

frameworkDimensions.name: Integration
frameworkDimensions.description: How you integrate experiences into identity

frameworkDimensions.name: Nurture
frameworkDimensions.description: How you care for yourself and others

questions.text: When you wake up in the morning, what typically gets you out of bed?

options.text: A sense of duty or responsibility to others
options.followUp: What would happen if those responsibilities disappeared? What would you do then?

options.text: Excitement about projects or goals I'm working on
options.followUp: Tell me more about what excites you. What lights you up?

options.text: Honestly, mostly habit or necessity (bills to pay, etc.)
options.followUp: If money wasn't a concern, what would get you out of bed?

options.text: The possibility of what the day might bring
options.followUp: What's the best thing a day has brought you recently?

questions.text: When something goes wrong, what's your first thought?

conditionalDisplay.reason: Exploring mindset patterns for those in duty/survival mode

options.text: What did I do wrong? This is probably my fault.
options.followUp: Is that always true? Can you think of a time when something went wrong and it genuinely wasn't about you?

options.text: What can I learn from this?
options.followUp: Love that. What's something you've learned from a recent setback?

options.text: Why does this always happen to me?
options.followUp: I hear you. Does it really always happen, or does it just feel that way sometimes?
That's powerful. How did you develop that ability to move forward?

routingLogic.description: Questions adapt based on previous responses to deepen relevant areas

then.reason: External motivation or survival mode suggests need for self-care exploration
Negative self-attribution + external motivation suggests coaching support needed

scoringAlgorithm.description: Each dimension scored 0-100 based on response patterns

interpretation.0-30: Struggling to find intrinsic motivation - may benefit from values exploration
interpretation.31-60: Mixed motivation patterns - some intrinsic, some external
interpretation.61-100: Strong intrinsic motivation and sense of purpose

interpretation.0-30: Fixed or negative mindset patterns - growth mindset training recommended
interpretation.61-100: Strong growth mindset and solution-focused thinking

recommend.description: Daily chat-based prompts to uncover what truly matters to you

recommend.reason: Negative mindset patterns + self-blame suggest need for deeper work
